definition: to enter the next grade school
to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]

sentences.english: The college entrance examinations are drawing near, and you should know where you are.
sentences.chinese: 大學升學考試就要到了，你應當知道你準備得如何。

sentences.english: Let's pray for the children who will take entrance exams this year.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們爲今年參加升學考試的孩子們祈禱。

sentences.english: The result indicated that most of primary school leavers had the deficiencies of primary-secondary.
sentences.chinese: 結果發現，初一新生普遍存在升學準備不足的狀況。

sentences.english: Elena:Without the pressure of furthering education, the schools can relax a little more too.
sentences.chinese: 少了升學考試的壓力在學校真的會輕鬆許多。

sentences.english: I had expected to go to college, but I failed in the entrance examination.
sentences.chinese: 我本希望上大學，但我沒有通過升學考試。

sentences.english: Tom, how was your entrance exam?
sentences.chinese: 湯姆，你的升學考試怎麼樣？

sentences.english: This school's enrollment quotas have surged by a large margin.
sentences.chinese: 這個學校的升學率大幅度躍升。

sentences.english: Man On Campus entrance examination results in accordance with the strict placement.
sentences.chinese: 文月學園是按照升學考試的成績嚴格分班。

sentences.english: Too few girls attend secondary school and even fewer go beyond.
sentences.chinese: 上中學的女童很少，再繼續升學的就更少了。

sentences.english: Third, the social development creates opportunities of further study for technical schools students.
sentences.chinese: 社會發展爲技校生創造的升學機會。

sentences.english: I studied several months for the college entrance exam.
sentences.chinese: 我花了幾個月的來大學升學考試。

sentences.english: It was the first time that junior middle school graduate had entrance examination of sports in our country.
sentences.chinese: 我國首次正式實行初中畢業生升學體育考試。

sentences.english: The proportion of students entering universities and colleges is revving up in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近幾年來考入大專院校的升學率正在不斷提高。

sentences.english: I spent much time in preparing for the entrance exam.
sentences.chinese: 我花費了很多時間準備升學考試。

sentences.english: The percentage of students entering a higher school against the total number of students.
sentences.chinese: 我們學校連年保持了較高的升學率。

sentences.english: Frank was sweating out the results of his entrance examination.
sentences.chinese: 弗蘭克正在焦急等待着他的升學結果。

definition: to enter a school or college/to go to school for the first time as a child
head of a household/family head/patriarch/parent or guardian of a child
to enter oneself for an examination
to go abroad/to leave the country/emigration
mainland China (PRC excluding Hong Kong and Macau, but including islands such as Hainan)/Japan (used in Taiwan during Japanese colonization)
specialty/specialized field/main field of study (at university)/major/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4]/professional
to undertake advanced studies/to take a refresher course
